image.altText: A crushed VB garden on dirt

props.synopsis: The CLP government's new law to try and keep anti-social behaviour off the streets has seen dozens of people hit with fines — but some question if it's actually stopping the problem.

title.children: Dozens fined, three arrested as NT public drinking law comes into force

image.altText: A screenshot of a video shows the yacht bobbing in shallow water

props.synopsis: Catherine Delves and Peter Watt had been en route to Borneo to see the orangutans when "things went pear-shaped".

title.children: 'Shipwrecked' Australians could be stuck on Indonesian island for a month

image.altText: A teenager wearing a black, yellow and red school polo shirt smiles at the camera, with a yellow scarf draped over shoulders

props.synopsis: Joyleen Butler had to travel around 2,000 kilometres to keep a promise to her late mother and finish high school. Now she's inspiring others from her remote community.

title.children: 'Inspiring' high school graduation a milestone for remote NT community

image.altText: Silhouette football and child

props.synopsis: Wadeye is one of the most isolated parts of Australia, but that hasn't stopped some of the country's most exciting young footballers from being noticed.

title.children: It’s a footy-mad community with no AFL player – but that may change

image.altText: A man stands with his hands on his hips in front of piles of waste materials.

props.synopsis: Discarded batteries, ancient rubber tyres and drums of oil are the kinds of waste sitting on Australia's remote cattle stations that could have a brand new life if a researcher's plan comes to fruition.

title.children: The challenges of dealing with waste on remote cattle stations

image.altText: search bar over photo of road with cars

props.synopsis: Will the cost-of-living crisis impact how you vote? These electorates are feeling the financial stress the most, but will it change the outcome on election day?

title.children: These parts of Australia — where budgets are pushed to the brink — could decide the election

image.altText: A closeup of Trump looking orange as he listens to someone else speaking

props.synopsis: Mexico and Canada have vowed to impose their own taxes on billions of dollars of trade with their closest neighbour.

title.children: Trump says US could feel 'pain' in trade war with Mexico, Canada, China

image.altText: A man's side profile in shadows with a phone close to his face

props.synopsis: A white supremacist group operating entirely online has been slapped with sanctions in an Australian first. Follow live.

title.children: White supremacist network hit with sanctions in antisemitism crackdown

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: No mandatory minimum sentencing for antisemitism, Labor confirms
Labor hopeful electoral reforms could live to see another day
Wong coy on link between white supremacist network and recent antisemitic attacks

image.altText: A large lightning bolt hits the ground at night with city lights and a bridge illuminated.

props.synopsis: Authorities have confirmed three homes have been destroyed during overnight storms across Victoria, including one home hit by lightning in Melbourne.

title.children: Victorian homes hit by lightning, destroyed by fires as heat continues

image.altText: A man with a grey beard and black cap and a blonde woman resting her hand on his shoulder smile in a radio studio.

props.synopsis: The radio host has revealed he will undergo brain surgery after being diagnosed with an aneurysm that requires "immediate attention".

title.children: Kyle Sandilands to undergo urgent brain surgery after aneurysm diagnosis

image.altText: Sabrina Carpenter poses in a powder blue gown

props.synopsis: The biggest names in music are arriving on the Grammys red carpet. See what they're wearing here.

title.children: 2025 Grammys red carpet: Sabrina Carpenter, Chappell Roan arrive

image.altText: The 67th Grammy Awards have kicked off in LA this morning.

props.synopsis: The biggest music stars have begun to arrive at the 67th Grammy awards for a night dedicated to victims of the LA wildfires. Follow live.

title.children: Early Grammy award winners announced at ceremony dedicated to LA fire victims

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Best Pop Vocal Album goes to Short n' Sweet by Sabrina Carpenter

image.altText: An older bald man with a short grey beard speaks in a crowd.

props.synopsis: Mohammad al-Halabi was released on Saturday, one of 183 Palestinian prisoners or detainees granted their freedom in exchange for Hamas releasing three Israeli hostages.

title.children: Former head of Australian aid program released from Israeli prison

image.altText: a person writing a cheque

props.synopsis: The ABC spoke with two family law experts to discuss de facto relationships, debts and how to protect yourself.

title.children: We asked experts how to protect your finances in a de facto relationship

image.altText: woman smiles slightly at camera

props.synopsis: International students are reporting a range of negative experiences, including overt racism and bias against them in the classroom. The Australian Human Rights Commission is preparing its final report on the prevalence and impact of racism in the country's universities.

title.children: International students report facing racism, bias regarding academic proficiency

image.altText: Celeste Barber stands with arms folded leaning against a graffiti wall. She wears a red and black short sleeve dress

props.synopsis: Celeste Barber has found global fame for her Instagram parodies of A-listers. But behind the laughs is a story about the dark side of ADHD.

title.children: Celeste Barber reveals why she will never call ADHD her 'superpower'

image.altText: Cristian Garin lies on the court after colliding with Zizou Bergs.

props.synopsis: Belgium will be Australia's next opponents in the Davis Cup, but only after advancing to the second qualifying round in bizarre circumstances.

title.children: Belgian Davis Cup player knocks over Chilean rival during on-court celebration

image.altText: Floodwaters rise around a property in the Townsville suburb of Condon.

props.synopsis: An emergency alert was issued for the town of Cardwell shortly after midnight as floodwaters continue to rise for a third day.

title.children: North Queensland town ordered to seek higher ground amid ongoing flood disaster

image.altText: A man carrying an Israeli flag stands in front of a house sprayed with antisemitic graffiti

props.synopsis: An extremism researcher says the protracted nature of the recent war has in part contributed to an "unprecedented" wave of antisemitic incidents in Australia.

title.children: Why Sydney is seeing so many antisemitic attacks of late

image.altText: An aerial view of the an arterial road and the suburban homes at Werribee on Melbourne's western fringe.

props.synopsis: The seat of Werribee is shaping up to be an interesting contest as party leaders eye the outer suburbs for key federal electoral success.

title.children: Why the previously safe seat of Werribee is one to watch this weekend

image.altText: Two women looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Labor's left faction has strengthened its hold over Queensland's parliamentary caucus, with two MPs defecting to its ranks from the once-dominant right faction.

title.children: Queensland Labor upheaval as MPs defect to rival faction

image.altText: Plastic water bottles sitting on a table.

props.synopsis: The tests show there is no need for concern in most parts of the state, but concerning levels of the "forever chemicals" have been detected in three regions.

title.children: PFAS testing blitz returns worrying results for some NSW communities

image.altText: aerial shot of Adelaide's water desalination plant

props.synopsis: South Australia's reservoirs are back to the low levels of the Millennium Drought era. But most of us aren't facing water restrictions this time around, largely because the state has something it didn't have back then – a desalination plant.

title.children: Without its desalination plant, SA would probably have water restrictions again

image.altText: blurry shot of a man and woman sitting on a park bench

props.synopsis: Chris has been using cannabis for the majority of his adult life, and says he used to get behind the wheel while under the influence, but it isn't something he does anymore.

title.children: Chris used to drive after smoking cannabis, but not anymore

image.altText: Students sitting on the ground in class, holding notepads and looking toward their teacher.

props.synopsis: Australian kids are back at school this week, but there has been a concerning decline in performance in numeracy and literacy tests over the past two decades. Today, education reporter Conor Duffy on why Australian students underperform and how one group is bucking the trend.

title.children: ABC News Daily: Who's to blame for declining school results?

image.altText: A sign indicating a 90kph speed limit stands on the side of a country road.

props.synopsis: A council in one of Western Australia's biggest tourist destinations has declined to participate in the nation's largest road safety trial despite a rising death toll.

title.children: Council in WA tourist hotspot rejects road safety trial

image.altText: Mary Fowler kicks the ball for Manchester City against Arsenal in a WSL match.

props.synopsis: Mary Fowler's brilliant run of form continues for Manchester City with another two goals, but it is not enough to prevent a 4-3 loss at home to Arsenal in the WSL.

title.children: Fowler double in vain as Manchester City loses to Arsenal

image.altText: A small black whale with a white oval-shaped marking on its side pokes out of the water.

props.synopsis: A newborn killer whale calf spotted off the southern coast of WA could be one of the youngest ever seen in Australian waters.

title.children: Orca researchers 'erupted' with excitement over newborn calf sighting

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou claps his hands after a Tottenham win in the Premier League.

props.synopsis: Amid mounting speculation surrounding Ange Postecoglou's future, Tottenham bounces back from a four-match losing streak in the Premier League with a 2-0 win at Brentford.

title.children: Spurs ease pressure on Postecoglou after snapping Premier League losing streak

image.altText: A prompt on a screen with the DeepSeek whale logo asking for input.

props.synopsis: China's new open-source AI chatbot DeepSeek has stoked pride at home but prompted concerns about censorship and data security abroad.

title.children: Chinese celebrate new AI tool prompting concerns abroad

image.altText: Unidentified guard opens secure door at Youth Justice centre

props.synopsis: A former youth offender sues the ACT government, alleging he was sexually assaulted by a guard at the former Quamby youth detention centre.

title.children: ACT government sued over alleged sexual assault by youth detention guard

image.altText: A smiling man, child and woman in a pool.

props.synopsis: A 10-week program helps adult migrants learn to swim and enjoy the water on the outskirts of Melbourne, after a spate of drownings on the nearby Bass Coast.

title.children: Migrant community learning to swim after tragic year of drownings

image.altText: Newsreader Season 3

props.synopsis: The ABC's award-winning drama The Newsreader is back for a third season — so how much does it get right about late-80s news and culture, and where are the white lies?

title.children: The real-world facts behind the fiction in The Newsreader's season 3
